column4: Meh. Ubuntu does not recognize my hard drive (Fujitsu MHW2020BH) and prompted me to select a particular driver needed for my HDD. How can I find out which driver I need? Is there some kind of list?
: how is it connected - usb firewire Sata?
Internal HDD.  SATA.
are your other disks connected this way?
Yes. And the other disks are disabled temporarily (in the bios) for this installation.
have you tried with them enabled and just that disk?
In the past, yes. It ended with the same result.
does teh bios have a PATA compatibility mode - or no raid?
I'm not setting up for RAID. I do recall there are something like PATA in the bios. I would have to check the bios again to verify exactly.
that option will present teh sata as a normal pata disk
Okay. I'll try that. (Be back in 5~)

Well, I enabled the PATA (although I had no PATA drives). I'm searching on engines for a particular driver module that I need to include. I just don't know which one to select (from a list of 50+ module).
hmm unlucky
which Version are you using? (ubuntu)
Well -- The development version but that's not really the issue in first place. I'm using minimal installation approach.
does it work when you use a full Live CD/USB?
It did. (when I was messing around with Kubuntu Live-Desktop Beta1).
Right why not fire it back up and work out which driver is making it work
lspci should give it you
That is a long way to find out. I'll look into my other machine. I might get lucky with something.
good luck
